title: Pam Brown: Where's the transparency Biden's White House promised?
description: CNN's Pamela Brown analyzes the Joe Biden White House's pledge of transparency against the current coronavirus response, and how they are clashing.

title: A second crisis is killing survivors of India's worst Covid wave
description: Srinivas S. lies on a gurney in an operating theater in St John's Hospital in Bengaluru as surgeons carefully remove bits of blackened tissue and rotten bone from his face.

title: Airport piano player earned $60,000 in tips after a stranger shared videos of him on Instagram
description: When Tonee "Valentine" Carter sits in front of a piano, his fingers take on a life of their own, dancing across the keys as he smiles, closes his eyes, and sinks into a melody.

title: 'Dating Game Killer' dies after years on death row
description: A convicted serial killer known as the "Dating Game Killer" died early Saturday morning at a hospital near Corcoran State Prison in central California, prison officials said.

title: Lynyrd Skynyrd guitarist recovering following emergency heart surgery
description: Lynyrd Skynyrd guitarist Gary Rossington is recovering after undergoing emergency heart surgery, the band said on its Facebook page.

title: Jim Acosta: Fox News viewers may have a case of whiplash
description: As Fox News changes some of its messaging on the coronavirus vaccine and Dr. Anthony Fauci, CNN's Jim Acosta calls out the network's delay in giving the truth to its viewers.

title: NSA review finds no evidence supporting Tucker Carlson's claims NSA was spying on him, sources say
description: A National Security Agency review of its intercepts did not find any evidence that Fox News host Tucker Carlson's communications were intercepted by the NSA, two sources familiar with the matter told CNN.

title: Dating app match turns in Jan. 6 suspect who allegedly whipped police
description: Yet another US Capitol suspect was caught this week, all thanks to his Bumble match.

title: A US hospital just hit its all-time high for Covid cases. But the county fair that attracts thousands won't be canceled
description: Amy Tignor remembers the crowds that attended the Ozark Empire Fair's rides, concerts and livestock shows in past years.

title: Dr. Gupta: Traveling to the Olympics was like traveling to cover a natural disaster
Travel to the Caribbean during Covid-19: What you need to know before you go
description: If you're planning to travel to the islands of the Caribbean, here's what you'll need to know and expect if you want to visit during the Covid-19 pandemic.

title: See husband surprise wife with long-lost wedding video
description: Drew and Kayla Gottfried thought their wedding video was lost forever. But when a friend found it, more than a decade later, Drew decided to give his wife a very special anniversary surprise.

title: One of the world's most elusive cats caught on camera for first time in 5 years
description: Camera traps in East Kazakhstan captured video of one of the world's most elusive cats for the first time since 2017 in the region.

title: Smerconish: Don't punish the unvaccinated
description: Don't bring back mask mandates, says Michael Smerconish: 'Instead of imposing further upon the vaccinated, let's up the pressure on the unvaccinated.' President Biden should mandate the jab for all Federal workers, including the military.

title: Secrets of Mars' core revealed for the first time
description: Have you ever spotted another planet in the sky? It's a celestial thrill without compare.

title: Olympic athletes struggle with 'brutal' weather
description: • Live updates: Here's who won gold medals on day one of the Olympics

title: Can psychedelics treat depression?
description: Psilocybin - the active ingredient found in magic mushrooms - Is being seriously considered for the treatment of mental health issues. How did we get here from the Grateful Dead and Kool-Aid Acid Test?

title: The big reason why Canada and the UK are beating the US on vaccinations
Radio host changes his tune on vaccines -- after he was hospitalized
description: For months, conservative Nashville, Tennessee-based radio host Phil Valentine has repeatedly made posts on multiple social media platforms telling his fans that if they weren't at risk for Covid-19, they shouldn't get the vaccine.

title: What happens if the Supreme Court throws out Roe v. Wade?
description: In some alternate universe, Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg retired during the Obama presidency and Democrats were able to push through a successor to the conservative Justice Antonin Scalia.

title: DEA agents seize cocaine disguised as a cake
description: A man and woman were arrested in Maine following the discovery of cocaine disguised as a cake in their vehicle, according to the Maine Drug Enforcement Agency.

title: Trump ally strikes $250M bail deal
description: A federal magistrate judge on Friday ordered Tom Barrack, a longtime associate of former President Donald Trump who was indicted earlier this week on charges of illegal foreign lobbying, released from jail pending trial, freeing him on a bail package that includes a $250 million bond secured by $5 million in cash.

title: Mac'n'cheese ice cream debuts and quickly sells out
description: Nothing gets cheddar than this...

title: Why would anyone trust Brexit Britain again?
Police to take over search efforts at the Florida condo building collapse site
description: Firefighters are turning over the search and recovery efforts at the Surfside condo building collapse to the Miami-Dade Police Department, officials said Friday.

title: Quarantine escapes and airplane disguises: Covid travel news this week
description: Which countries are tightening their Covid corsets and which are letting it all hang loose? CNN Travel reveals all in our latest weekend round-up.

title: Scores dead in India as rains trigger floods and landslides
description: At least 112 people have died in the western Indian state of Maharashtra, authorities said on Friday, after torrential monsoon rains caused landslides and flooded low-lying areas, cutting off hundreds of villages.

title: Genocide denial to be punished by jail in Bosnia
description: Bosnia's outgoing international peace overseer decreed amendments to its criminal code on Friday to allow jail terms for the denial of the 1995 Srebrenica genocide, a frequently expressed view among nationalist Serbs.

title: Fire whirls, 'pyro' clouds, and hazy skies: Extreme fire behavior is a preview of what's to come
description: Dozens of wildfires currently blazing across the West have been exhibiting extreme fire behavior: demonstrating alarming rotational patterns and wafting smoke across the country while also creating their own weather.

title: Taiwan fears a cyber 'World War III'
description: As China steps up military pressure on Taiwan, the self-governing island is preparing for the next big frontier of warfare: crippling cyberattacks.

title: Tokyo 2020 isn't the first Olympic Games to battle a pandemic
description: Covid-19 has thrown more than few curve balls at Tokyo Olympic organizers -- but this isn't the first Games to battle a pandemic.

title: Biden back on the campaign trail: 'I whipped Donald Trump in Virginia and so will Terry'
Athletes who've had to drop out because of Covid-19
description: The 2020 Summer Olympics are finally underway in Tokyo.

title: Radio host dismissed vaccine's importance. Now he's hospitalized with Covid-19
The rise in US Covid-19 hospitalizations is a self-inflicted wound, expert says
description: Health experts blame the recent surges in Covid-19 cases on the low rate of vaccinations, and now the accelerating Delta variant is threatening to increase hospitalizations and deaths as well, an expert said.

title: Why North Korea is so afraid of K-pop
description: North Korea is doubling down on its culture war, warning citizens to stay away from all things South Korean -- including its fashion, music, hairstyles and even slang.

title: Nurse says patients in ICU with Covid-19 begging for vaccine
description: CNN's Randi Kaye spoke to a nurse in a hospital in Florida about patients in the ICU with Covid-19 begging for the vaccine.

title: New Capitol Police chief says he'd be 'a fool to not be concerned' about ongoing threat
description: In his first day on the job, Tom Manger -- the new chief of the US Capitol Police -- said Friday that he would be "a fool to not be concerned" about the threat of more attacks on the Capitol, especially given chatter on extremists' forums about possible action in August.
